Name: Painted canopic jar lid
Description: Crudely fashioned canopic jar lid of pottery, in the form of a jackal head, painted in black with details of hair, collar, eyes and nostrils in a bright pale yellow. The jackal was used to depict Duamutef, one of the four sons of Horus protecting the internal organs. This lid was found at Abydos, and dated by the excavator, Petrie, to the 3rd Intermediate Period.
